alert.note: Alert for Anson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 30 at 3:11PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Anson, Cumberland, Hoke, Richmond, Sampson and Scotland. * WHEN...Until 915 PM EDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 308 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. A combination of the heavy rain and strong wind will also increase the risk of uprooted trees. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fayetteville, Laurinburg, Rockingham, Clinton, Wadesboro, Raeford, Fort Bragg, Dunn, Hamlet, Ansonville, Hoffman, Harrells, Godwin, Antioch, Pope AFB, Hope Mills, Spring Lake, Eastover, Polkton and Roseboro. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
